description: Most of the dead were the club’s kitchen workers, and included three women, Chief Minister Pramod Sawant said

description: The 32-year-old pace spearhead has not played since picking up the issue against the West Indies mid-year.

Neighbours in uniform: police in north of Hyderabad reach out to senior citizens living alone
description: Officers from the North Zone of Hyderabad police are visiting senior citizens living alone, checking on their safety, verifying domestic help and offering support against cyber fraud, while also linking them with local communities to reduce isolation and improve access to routine assistance.

description: The poll, coming less than two weeks after an apartment fire that killed at least 159 people, is a possible test of public sentiment about the government's handling of the tragedy

title: Morning Digest: 23 killed in Goa’s Arpora nightclub fire; MetLife Stadium set to host the World Cup final as FIFA announces complete schedule, and more
description: Here is a select list of stories to start the day.

title: Zelenskyy signals progress in talks with US on peace plan for Russia-Ukraine war
China’s jets directed fire-control radar at Japanese aircraft over international waters, Tokyo says
description: Democratically governed Taiwan is claimed by Beijing and lies just 110 kilometres (68.4 miles) from Japan’s westernmost Yonaguni Island

title: Aditya Dhar’s Dhurandhar pushes a bigoted vision, gaslighting the audience into accepting it as entertainment
Goa nightclub inferno: How cylinder blast sparked deadly blaze, killing 23 people
description: A devastating fire at a North Goa nightclub, Birch by Romeo Lane, claimed at least 23 lives late Saturday night, primarily club employees. Officials suspect a cylinder blast triggered the blaze, with most victims succumbing to suffocation. The Chief Minister indicated potential non-compliance with fire safety norms, promising action against management and officials.

title: IndiGo fiasco: Body of Tripura med student who died in UP stuck in Delhi

Fewer cancellations but chaos continues, fares still sky high on day 3 of IndiGo crisis

TRAGEDY ON DELHI-MUMBAI E-Way: Patrol vehicle missed mangled car, couple bled slowly to death

Bomb threats sent to Delhi Union of Journalists, IWPC; declared hoax
‘God gave me responsibility, will take care of kids’: Kin of couple suffocated to death in Outer Delhi shop fire

description: A better understanding of the complementarity of science and Humanities will be essential for a functional and progressive society

title: Two students die after car hits motorcycle in Outer North Delhi

Gujarat ex-IAS officer gets 5-year jail term in money laundering case
Woman submits false information about sons during SIR survey in UP’s  Rampur, three booked
Mumbai: After 8 years in jail, man acquitted in Pocso case over ‘scanty evidence’
description: A 56-year-old driver, jailed for eight years, has been acquitted of sexual assault charges. The Pocso court found the prosecution failed to prove the victim's age and intellectual capacity, citing major inconsistencies.  Defense argued false implication due to a prior dispute. The judge highlighted scanty evidence, granting the accused the benefit of doubt.

title: Congress shares ‘original’ diary entry of Patel’s daughter, seeks Rajnath apology
Rahul India’s weakest link: BJP amid row over ‘no invite’ to LoP
Marathon organisers arrested in Iran for allowing women to compete without wearing hijab
Metrowater hikes tanker tariffs; removes daily cap on complexes
description: Officials say price has been revised after six years to offset growing production cost and higher rates quoted by tankers that operate on contract; large-capacity lorries will cater to the suburbs; residents seek expansion of piped network

title: In Kerala, over 20 lakh SIR forms ‘uncollectible’
'Dhurandhar' collection: Ranveer Singh's spy actioner crosses Rs 50 crore mark
description: Ranveer Singh's latest film, 'Dhurandhar,' is taking the box office by storm with an impressive Rs 58 crore net earned in just its first two days. Directed by Aditya Dhar, this gripping spy thriller has surged in popularity, powered by outstanding word-of-mouth and packed theatres on Saturday.

title: Vanvas in the age of noise
Southern Railway to operate special trains, add AC coaches due to flight cancellations
description: Special trains include the Nagercoil to Tambaram superfast (December 7) and the Tambaram-Nagercoil superfast (December 8).

title: Kane scores hat-trick as Bayern extends Bundesliga lead to 11 points
description: The England captain took his goal tally for Bayern Munich this season to 28 and the defending champions extended their lead to 11 points after thrashing Stuttgart 5-0 on the road.

title: ‘Dead’ in 2013 floods to theft accused: Pune hospital unites man with family
‘Will never go to Delhi’: Sunali visits home, hospitalised
'Stay self-decided': EAM on Hasina's extradition; future hinges on circumstances
description: In a recent statement, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar highlighted that Sheikh Hasina's visit to India is a personal decision shaped by last year's developments. He underscored India's unwavering support for Bangladesh, reiterating the importance of democratic values. Jaishankar also defended India's sovereignty in foreign relations, stressing that no nation has the authority to dictate its alliances with others.

title: 'Played without captain': Gambhir hides behind 'excuses' for Test series defeat
description: Head coach Gautam Gambhir has firmly rejected social media speculation about split coaching for Indian cricket. He expressed surprise at these theories, urging commentators to respect their boundaries. Gambhir highlighted that the recent Test series loss to South Africa was discussed without acknowledging the absence of the captain and main batter in the crucial first Test.

title: Not Rohit or SKY: Abhishek Sharma achieves what no Indian ever has in T20
description: Abhishek Sharma has etched his name in T20 history, becoming the first Indian to smash 100 sixes in a calendar year. His explosive 62 off 34 balls against Services in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy propelled him to this milestone. Sharma's remarkable year includes 1,499 runs at a staggering strike rate of over 200, showcasing his dominance.

title: IND vs SA: Kohli roasts Arshdeep after ODI series win over South Africa - Watch
description: India clinched the ODI series 2-1 against South Africa with a dominant nine-wicket victory. Virat Kohli, back to his best, was the series' top scorer and expressed a newfound mental freedom.  The bowlers, particularly Prasidh Krishna and Kuldeep Yadav, were instrumental in restricting South Africa, showcasing improved wicket-taking ability.  The win boosts Indian morale ahead of the T20 series.

title: Tonnes of solid waste generated on Maha Deepam day removed during clean-up drive
Magnitude 7 earthquake hits remote wilderness along Alaska-Canada border; over 30 aftershocks follow
description: The U.S. Geological Survey said it struck about 370 kilometres northwest of Juneau, Alaska, and 250 kilometres west of Whitehorse, Yukon.

title: Call prisons correctional homes: CJI Surya Kant
Flight chaos triggers fare cap: IndiGo gets 2-day fix window; rescheduling fees scrapped
description: The government has imposed a Rs 18,000 domestic airfare cap and ordered IndiGo to restore full operations within two days, citing exorbitant fares and mass cancellations.  Aviation authorities invoked powers to ensure fair pricing and mandated refunds, aiming to protect passengers from opportunistic charges amidst a significant operational disruption.

title: Diplomatic tightrope: Red carpet for Putin, now Delhi works on dates for Zelenskyy visit

description: When people see neighbours lighting crackers or farmers burning stubble without consequences, compliance collapses

title: ‘Ghaznavid invasions’ get bigger section in new class 7 NCERT textbook
Epic Greaves double ton earns West Indies draw in first NZ Test
description: Set a colossal target of 531, 113 more than the current record for a successful fourth-innings chase, the West Indies were 457-6 at the end, the second-highest Test fourth innings.

title: Steaming silences at academic corridors
description: Let tea dissolve hierarchy. In that circle, there must be no Head of Department, no Junior Research Fellow, no Professor Emeritus. Only co-drinkers.

title: Congress cites Maniben’s diary, seeks apology from Rajnath
Verstappen takes pole position for F1 title-deciding Abu Dhabi GP ahead of Norris and Piastri
description: The thrilling three-way battle will be decided on Sunday (December 7, 2025) at the Yas Marina Circuit. The McLaren driver Norris is 12 points ahead of Red Bull's Verstappen and 16 ahead of McLaren teammate Piastri.

title: At Vatican observatory, Goa priest decoding cosmic past
description: Jesuit priest Fr Richard D’Souza, a galactic archaeologist at the Vatican Observatory, studies galactic cannibalism. His 2018 research in Nature Astronomy revealed the Andromeda galaxy's major merger occurred two billion years ago. D’Souza, who balances cosmic research with faith, now directs the historic observatory, reminding the Church of science and faith's synergy.

title: Continuing divides
description: Every conversation veers around to a quick sketch of where a person sits in the country’s endlessly negotiated social hierarchy

title: People near mines inhaling danger: Lok Sabha data flags lung harm; calls grow for tighter safeguards
description: Recent findings indicate that neighborhoods adjacent to Indian mining operations are experiencing significant lung health issues and exposure to heavy metals, reflecting the dangers faced by workers. Research highlights concerning levels of abnormal lung function and signs of fibrosis, even among children, underscoring the severe impact of dust pollution.

title: What did Putin’s visit to India achieve? | Explained
description: Where do India-Russia relations stand? What did the two sides agree on during the recent summit? What statements did both leaders make on the Ukraine war? Why is Putin’s visit significant at this juncture when India is negotiating a free trade agreement with the U.S.?

title: Horoscope Today – December 7, 2025: What Do the Stars Hold for Leo, Pisces, Virgo, Aquarius and Taurus Today? Your Complete Astrological Guide
The paradox of right and wrong
description: The essence of morality lies not in action, but in awareness

title: One-day gap no ground to deny increment: HC rules for BSF retiree; dues to be released
description: In a landmark decision, the Punjab and Haryana high court has upheld the rights of a retired BSF inspector, affirming that a year of dedicated service cannot be dismissed based on a matter of mere hours. The court emphasized that increments earned are a testament to the hard work put in, not to be undermined by technicalities.

title: Halloween impact
description: The attraction for the surreal and unknown transcends generations and classes

title: ‘Can’t take torture by wife’: Man’s body exhumed after recovery of clip in locked phone
Hamas says will give up arms to a Palestinian authority 'if occupation ends'
description: Our weapons are linked to the existence of the occupation and the aggression," Hamas chief negotiator and its Gaza chief Khalil al-Hayya said in a statement

title: Bareilly demolition halted by HC: ‘Due process first’; civic body told to hear residents
description: Allahabad High Court has halted the demolition of 27 homes in Bareilly's Shahabad area, emphasizing due process. Residents, who had been paying taxes for years, received notices declaring their homes illegal. The court directed the civic body to issue a reasoned order after a personal hearing, preventing any coercive action until then.

title: 23 dead in midnight fire at Goa club
The movie magic
description: Many of them run on outlandish formulas and offer naive solutions

title: J&K exam age row erupts: Omar targets LG over delay; Raj Bhavan counters claim
description: A political spat has erupted over age relaxation for Jammu and Kashmir's civil services exam. Chief Minister Omar Abdullah accused Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha of delaying a crucial file, while the LG's office countered that misleading claims are circulating. Aspirants face uncertainty as the December 7 exam approaches, with student protests demanding an age limit increase.

title: 23 killed in midnight blaze at Goa club; three women among victims
description: We will take action against the club management and also officials who allowed them to operate despite flouting safety norms, says Chief Minister Pramod Sawant

title: Boeing says Trump's equity stake plan doesn't apply to big U.S. defence firms
description: It really only applies on the supply chain, particularly for the smaller companies coming through, where that might be a way forward for them to get some equity, says  CEO of Boeing Defense, Space & Security

title: India witnessing a ‘psychological renaissance’: PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi declared India is experiencing a "psychological renaissance," shedding a colonial mindset that once labeled its slow growth the "Hindu rate of growth." He asserted the nation is now a global economic driver, lauded for its rapid development amidst a worldwide slowdown. This transformation, he emphasized, signifies a profound shift in national confidence and global standing.

title: Satellite-based phone tracking under study: Privacy a hurdle; device makers, govt at odds
description: Government discussions are under way for mandatory satellite-assisted mobile phone tracking for law enforcement and disaster management. The proposal, stalled for five years due to privacy concerns and device maker reluctance, aims for more accurate location data than current tower-based methods. Manufacturers like Apple and Samsung are wary of potential misuse and insist on user consent for such pinpoint tracking.

title: Customs overhaul next: FM vows cleaner, tech-led regime; duties may be cut further
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced comprehensive reforms for Customs, aiming for greater transparency and simplified compliance.  Following successful Income Tax Act overhauls, the government plans to introduce technology for faster goods clearance and reduce discretionary powers.  Customs duties will also be reviewed and lowered where necessary, marking this as the next significant reform initiative.

title: At least 18 migrants killed as inflatable boat sinks south of Greek island of Crete; 2 rescued
description: The half-sunken boat was located on Saturday by a passing Turkish merchant vessel, authorities said. Two survivors were rescued and a rescue operation to find more was ongoing.

title: Cartel de los Soles | Mission Maduro
description: The U.S decision to designate the alleged cartel a foreign terrorist organisation is aimed at strengthening its case for military action in Venezuela

title: Bengal SIR row: SC, ST activists urge ECI to simplify rules, set up assistance camps
description: In a letter to the CEC, the rights body appealed for marginalised people to be able to link themselves to any relative across their extended family whose name is present in the electoral roll of 2002, and urged the Commission to organise assistance camps

title: S. Muralidhar | Humane justice
description: The former Chief Justice of the Orissa High Court will head a UN Commission to investigate human rights violations in the occupied Palestinian territories

title: J&K L-G and CM spar over age relaxation for job aspirants amid protests
description: Hundreds of job aspirants who have crossed the age bar of 32 are unable to sit for the examination. The Open Merit aspirants are protesting to increase the current upper age limit from 32 to 37 to bring it at par with the rest of the country.

title: ‘SC ruling on wedding gifts a win for all Muslim women’
description: A landmark Supreme Court ruling grants divorced Muslim women the right to reclaim wedding gifts from their parents.  Rousanara Begum's two-decade legal battle culminated in this victory, affirming women's dignity and property rights.  This precedent-setting judgment clarifies that gifts given to a bride belong to her, offering hope to many across India.

title: Bengal SIR 1st phase almost over, 28L remain unmapped, may face EC hearing
description: As Bengal gears up for the finalization of its electoral roll, the digitization process has covered nearly all of the 7.6 crore voters. However, a significant number—approximately 28-30 lakh—need to attend hearings to clarify data inconsistencies and stay on the rolls. Furthermore, over 54 lakh voters are being eliminated due to reasons such as inaccessibility, death, or duplication.

title: Car hits bike in Shahbad Dairy; two die
Sam Altman | Merchant of the future
description: The OpenAI CEO has declared a ‘code red’ at his company as the ChatGPT-maker rushes to turbocharge its chatbot’s performance; his urgency comes shortly after Google unveiled its powerful Gemini 3 model

title: Qatari leader says the Gaza ceasefire is at a critical moment
Official figures of the capacity in Delhi’s night shelter homes belie ground reality
Foundation for ‘Babri’ masjid in West Bengal sparks political fire
description: A controversial foundation ceremony for a mosque, described as "Babri Masjid-styled," in Murshidabad on the anniversary of the 1992 demolition sparked political and communal tensions. Thousands attended the event organized by a suspended MLA, who declared it "emotional restitution." Political parties reacted sharply, with the TMC distancing itself and the BJP accusing it of vote bank politics.

title: Attempts to create religious conflict over lighting lamp atop Thirupparankundram failed, says Minister Sekarbabu
‘Historic blunders’ on J&K and China are Nehru’s legacy: BJP
description: Under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, those “blunders” are being corrected, says BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.

title: Anonymous letter claiming faculty ‘data manipulation’ sparks row at Hansraj College
TN Deepam dispute heats up: DMK targets BJP; Nainar counters with ‘Ayodhya’ remark
description: A political spat erupted over the Karthigai Deepam lighting in Tirupparankundram, with DMK accusing BJP of inciting communal unrest. BJP state chief Nainar Nagenthran defended the move, stating there was no harm in the area resembling Ayodhya and dismissing fears of riots.

title: Assam: Govt backs Tezpur university pro-VC pick; protests intensify
description: Tezpur University students blocked Union higher education secretary Vineet Joshi's convoy after a meeting on allegations against the "absconding" vice chancellor ended without action. Protests, now in their 79th day, demand the VC's resignation amid concerns over financial irregularities and questionable appointments. The ministry is examining the allegations and will report to the President.

title: Bakelite, the first synthetic plastic
description: On December 7, 1909, Belgian-American chemist Leo Baekeland’s process patent for making Bakelite was granted, two years after he had figured it out. Bakelite is the first fully synthetic plastic and its invention marked the beginning of the Age of Plastics. A.S.Ganesh tells you more about Baekeland and his Bakelite…

title: On his 70th death anniversary, CM says Ambedkar’s ideals as relevant as ever
The Banyan launches Keshav Desiraju Lived Experience Repository

Biocon to merge biologics unit in $5.5 billion deal
description: Biocon has announced a bold step in the biopharmaceutical landscape by merging its biosimilars division, Biocon Biologics, into the parent organization for $5.5 billion. This ambitious strategy is designed to streamline operations and amplify its influence across global markets, especially in diabetes care, cancer treatment, and immune therapies.

title: CM blames past regimes for pollution, vows stronger and faster control efforts
description: Govt. ‘extremely serious’ about curbing pollution, dust being tackled through wall-to-wall road construction and city aiming to shift all public transport to EVs by 2026, says Gupta; over ₹7 crore in penalties imposed on polluting construction sites: Environment Minister

description: Quad nations have strongly condemned terrorism, including cross-border acts, and offered condolences for the Red Fort incident. Despite Quad summit delays, the group remains active, recently holding counterterrorism workshops and a tabletop exercise. Members emphasized information sharing and cooperation to keep the Indo-Pacific free from terror threats, with India and the US pushing for UN sanctions on terror groups.

title: FIFA World Cup 2026 | MetLife Stadium to host the final as FIFA announces complete schedule
description: Seventy-eight games will be in the U.S., including all from the quarterfinals on, and 13 apiece in Canada and Mexico.

description: Size of these farms vary from 30 cents to a few acres, with crops such as paddy being grown on them; students are taught to do farm work and given farm fresh food, while introduced to a nature-centric lifestyle; some offer programmes and syllabuses focusing on practical aspects of farming

description: Despite appeals for renovation works, Department of Technical Education has not sought funds from the State government, citing budget constraints

description: In a significant development, Jharkhand's chief minister Hemant Soren has been granted bail by a special MP/MLA court amid allegations of ignoring summons from the Enforcement Directorate. Following directions from the Jharkhand High Court, Soren has appeared in court and submitted the necessary bail bonds, ensuring he won't have to attend further hearings unless specifically called upon.

title: Appoint Leaders of Opposition for Maharashtra Assembly: Uddhav
description: More than a year after the Assembly election, ‘the LoP must be appointed and we have been demanding this’ the Shiv Sena (UBT) leader said

title: Michael Jordan’s court appearance sparks huge fan reaction outside courthouse
description: Basketball legend Michael Jordan testified in court on December 5, 2025, regarding a legal matter involving his 23XI Racing team and NASCAR. Outside the courthouse, a large crowd gathered, with one fan's heartfelt shout of "I love you Michael Jordan, you're an icon man. You're the best!" going viral, reflecting his enduring global influence.

description: IndiGo is recovering from massive flight cancellations, operating over 1500 flights today after a Friday with 1600 disruptions. New pilot duty rules caused the chaos, impacting over 1,000 flights. The airline has received temporary relief from DGCA. Passengers can track flight and refund status online, with refunds mandated by Sunday evening.

description: The capability has been developed in collaboration with IIT-Hyderabad under Project PRABAL (Portable Robotic Printer for Printing Bunkers and Accessories) and marks a powerful advancement in sustainable and mission-ready construction along the northern borders

title: Myanmar citizens head to early polls in Bangkok
description: There are around half a million documented Myanmar nationals in the capital, according to Thailand's labour ministry.

Germany's Merz makes first visit to Israel as chancellor
description: Merz, after stopping in Jordan for talks with King Abdullah II, is set to fly on to Israel in the evening before meeting Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in Jerusalem

title: Nothing like one’s own country, says Sunali after returning from Bangladesh
description: Four others, including Sunali’s husband who were allegedly pushed into Bangladesh in June earlier this year, are still awaiting their release from Bangladesh.

title: IVF pushes 9 in 10 couples into catastrophic debt
description: A new study reveals nearly 90% of Indian couples undergoing IVF face catastrophic expenditure, even in public hospitals, with costs averaging Rs 1.1 lakh. Over half borrow money, and only 5% have limited insurance, highlighting a significant financial crisis driven by infertility treatments.

title: ‘He kept giving me small targets that I need to focus on’: Yashasvi Jaiswal opens up about chat with Virat Kohli during India’s run chase vs South Africa in Vizag

description: India's Russian crude imports may hit a four-year low in January 2026 due to US sanctions, forcing refiners to seek alternatives. Despite pressure, Russia is exploring new channels, with potential for non-sanctioned oil flows to resume. India's strategic need for cost-effective energy and Russia's efforts to maintain trade suggest this dip might be temporary.

title: South Africa shooting: Gunmen open fire at illegal Pretoria bar; 12 killed
description: Gunmen opened fire at an illegal bar in Pretoria's Saulsville township early Saturday, killing at least 12 people, including a three-year-old child and two teenagers. Police reported 25 people were shot in the indiscriminate attack, which is the latest in a string of mass shootings plaguing South Africa. The motive is unknown, and a manhunt is underway for the suspects.

title: ‘Metaverse’ budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
description: Meta is reportedly planning to significantly cut its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its virtual reality ambitions. This move follows substantial losses and a lack of consumer interest in its VR products. The company is now prioritizing its artificial intelligence initiatives.

title: Sabalenka & Frangulis net worth: Earnings, endorsements and ventures
description: Tennis star Aryna Sabalenka and her boyfriend, Oakberry founder Georgios Frangulis, are a financially successful couple. Sabalenka boasts a net worth in the high teens of millions from her WTA career and endorsements, while Frangulis's stake in his rapidly expanding açaí company places him in the multi-million-dollar range. Their combined wealth is estimated to be in the tens of millions.
